awd_titl_txt: Analysis of Decametric Radio Observatories of the Collision of Comet S-L9 with Jupiter
awd_abstract_narration: 95-26300  Reyes  As part of NSF-funded follow-up studies of the Comet  Shoemaker-Levy 9 impact on Jupiter in July 1994, Dr. Reyes  will reduce, analyze, and interpret radio observations  carried out before, during, and after the event.  Most of  the observations were carried out with the University of  Florida Radio Observatory, the University of Chile Radio  Observatory, and Caltech's Owens Valley Radio Observatory.  These data will be complemented with data gathered during  the week of the collision at radio observatories in Japan,  Tasmania, and Australia.    The objectives are to investigate possible effects of the  collision of the comet fragments on the mean peak flux  densities of the normal Jovian radio emission, and to  determine the locations of sources of mechanisms for  emission of radio bursts.    Finally, Dr. Reyes will compile and publish a catalog of the  observations.  **
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
